meanings.definition: To fill (someone) with the urge or ability to do or feel something, especially to do something creative.
meanings.sent1: After watching the artist paint, she felt reinspired to create her own masterpiece.
meanings.sent2: The motivational speaker's words were able to reinspire the discouraged students to pursue their dreams.
meanings.sent3: The sight of the colorful sunset reinspired her to try painting again.
meanings.sent4: The success story of the young entrepreneur reinspired her belief in her own abilities.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's passion for learning reinspired the students to explore new ideas.

meanings.definition: To give (someone) renewed energy or enthusiasm for a task or goal.
meanings.sent1: The team meeting served to reinspire everyone to work together towards success.
meanings.sent2: The coach's pep talk was able to reinspire the team to give their best performance.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected win reinspired the team to aim for even greater victories.
meanings.sent4: The supportive community reinspired her to continue pursuing her passion for art.
meanings.sent5: The music festival's energy reinspired him to pick up his guitar and play again.
